name: Jason Shapiro From Crowded Market Report
title: Chart Of The Week Bitcoin
text:
Synopsis
Bitcoin's historical price movement appears to be inversely correlated with Large Speculators' positioning, with rallies typically occurring after they become net short.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin futures market data shows that historically, the cryptocurrency has not been able to rally when Large Speculators are net-long
- The last two Bitcoin rallies occurred after Large Speculators were positioned heavily on the short side
- The analysis suggests tracking weekly Commitments of Traders (COT) data released on Fridays for potential market insights
